channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Japan Botched a Satellite Launch in One of the Weirdest Ways Possible
item.description: Japan's H3 rocket lost its payload fairing around 4 minutes after launch, leaving a satellite exposed and hanging on for dear life.

item.title: AI Agents Have Their Own Social Network Now, and They Would Like a Little Privacy
item.description: Moltbook is a place for chatbots to link and connect with other chatbots, and all we can do is watch.

item.title: ‘There’s something to be said when, 5 minutes before you go on air, someone slides you a card of what you’re going to say if a person falls off a building and dies,’ Skyscraper Live host responds to criticism of anxiety-filled broadcast
item.description: ‘I totally get it’ Skyscraper Live host understands why fans were frustrated with the show.

item.title: Informant told FBI that Jeffrey Epstein had a ‘personal hacker’
item.description: The hacker allegedly developed zero-day exploits and offensive cyber tools and sold them to several countries, including an unnamed central African government, the U.K., and the United States.

item.title: February’s Lego Releases Want You to Catch ‘Em All
item.description: Lego is following its blockbuster January with one of its biggest new lines in years: Pokémon.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Season 2 features seven new weapons, including a brutal handheld buzzsaw
item.description: Activision has lifted the lid on what fans can expect come Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Season 2.

item.title: This $50 IKEA air purifier looks like a little Scandi suitcase and has everything you need for clean air whenever you go
item.description: The simple, squared-off design can stand upright or be laid on its side.

item.title: Instagram might soon let you remove yourself from someone’s Close Friends list
item.description: Since the feature's launch in 2018, users haven't been able to remove themselves from someone else's Close Friends list.

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on the moon
item.description: The company is trying to take advantage of President Donald Trump's desire to return astronauts to the lunar surface by the end of his term.

item.title: George R.R. Martin Almost Planned a Very Different Kind of Targaryen Power for ‘Game of Thrones’
item.description: There have been some hints of it in 'House of the Dragon' and 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms.'

item.title: This AI-related lawsuit could be just the beginning of many
item.description: Two workers are suing an AI hiring platform, alleging the technology violates consumer protections. What many applicants may not realize is that, nowadays, the first hurdle in applying for a job is dealing with AI. Candidates now often must clear an artificial intelligence system that screens their résumés that quietly determines who advances, and whose application is filed away in a drawer or spam folder, never to see the light of day. ...

item.title: You might qualify for this Kaiser settlement without ever filing a complaint
item.description: Customers who received multiple marketing texts after unsubscribing may qualify for compensation. If you’ve received any text messages from California-based healthcare giant Kaiser Permanente, you could be eligible for cash under the terms of a new settlement.

item.title: What to know about Trump’s Fed chair nominee Kevin Warsh
item.description: At 35, Warsh became the youngest governor on the Fed’s seven member board, serving in that post from 2006 to 2011. President Donald Trump says he’ll tap former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair to replace Jerome Powell in May — with Trump believing that he can finally get the booming economy that he promised to voters.

item.title: Sonos’ Super Bowl sale knocks hundreds off its audio gear
item.description: Sonos isn’t exactly synonymous with the Super Bowl, although the brand discounts its gear every year around this time like clockwork. It’s knocking 20 percent off many of its marquee products, including soundbars and standalone speakers — all of which can be paired together to improve sound quality and to put audio in more places […]

item.title: I Let Google’s ‘Auto Browse’ AI Agent Take Over Chrome. It Didn’t Quite Click
item.description: Auto Browse can shop for clothes, plan a trip, and buy tickets for you. Or at least, that’s the idea.

item.title: Elon Musk Emailed With Jeffrey Epstein to Plan Island Visits in 2012 and 2014
item.description: Epstein wrote an email to Musk in 2013 discussing a visit with four "assistants," newly released DOJ documents show.

item.title: Nvidia's next-gen full Earth-2 digital twin AI models will predict and forecast the next big storm faster and more accurately
item.description: Nvidia Earth-2 AI models integrate high-resolution data and open source tools to deliver faster, more accurate global and local weather forecasts.

item.title: The Farmers’ Almanac isn’t dead. It’s getting a digital reboot under a new owner
item.description: The almanac will keep operating despite announcing in November that its 208-year run was coming to an end. The Farmers’ Almanac isn’t going out of business after all, but it is leaving Maine for the bright lights of New York City and a new owner.

item.title: NASA used Claude to plot a route for its Perseverance rover on Mars
item.description: Since 2021, NASA's Perseverance rover has achieved a number of historic milestones, including sending back the first audio recordings from Mars. Now, nearly five years after landing on the Red Planet, it just achieved another feat. This past December, Perseverance successfully completed a route through a section of the Jezero crater plotted by Anthropic's Claude chatbot, marking the first time NASA has used a large language model to pilot the car-sized robot. Between December 8 and 10, Perseverance drove approximately 400 meters (about 437 yards) through a field of rocks on the Martian sur...
